title: Sanchez booked in jail, says focus on recovery
content: Former NFL quarterback Mark Sanchez has been booked and released from a jail in Indianapolis, telling a reporter that he was focused on his recovery from stab wounds he suffered in the altercation that resulted in multiple charges against him.

title: Tucker on free agency, Cubs return: 'We'll see'
content: Outfielder Kyle Tucker, who is one of the biggest prizes on the free agent market, isn't sure he'll be back with the Cubs. "If not, it was an honor," he said.

title: Bichette off Jays' ALCS roster; Scherzer, Bassitt on
content: Shortstop Bo Bichette will not return for the ALCS vs. the Mariners, while pitchers Max Scherzer and Chris Bassitt were added to Toronto's roster.

title: Allar injured, out for year as Penn St. skid hits 3
content: Penn State quarterback Drew Allar, who left the Nittany Lions' stunning 22-21 loss to Northwestern, is out for the season, coach James Franklin said in his postgame media availability, not long after his reeling team fell to 3-3.

title: Sanders endorses fans rushing field as fine looms
content: Colorado fans stormed the field after the Buffaloes' victory over No. 22 Iowa State. The act could trigger a $50,000 fine, something coach Deion Sanders was shocked to find out.

title: Gauff reels off 4 games vs. Pegula to win Wuhan
content: Coco Gauff, trailing 5-3, reeled off four straight games in the second set to beat Jessica Pegula and capture the Wuhan Open in all-American final.

title: Tiger endures seventh back surgery in 11 years
content: Tiger Woods underwent lumbar disk replacement surgery Friday, his second surgery of the year along with a March procedure for a ruptured Achilles tendon and seventh back surgery since April 2014.

title: 👀 Week 7 trolls: Northwestern, Texas post jabs
content: Northwestern and Texas were among the programs to offer petty posts after wins in Week 7 of the college football season.

title: Week 6 inactives: Who's in (Ja'Marr Chase?) and who's out (Kyler Murray?)
content: Updated inactives and analysis based on the latest reports and official announcements leading up to kickoff.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 6
content: An all-encompassing look at matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks, plus projected scores for every game.

title: Takeaways, best moments from Brewers' NLDS Game 5 win over Cubs
content: With a win against their division rivals, the Brewers move on to a date with the Dodgers in the NLCS.

title: NFL predictions, fantasy sleepers, trends for Week 6: Keep an eye on Sam Darnold?
content: Could Darnold be a fantasy sleeper? Can the Chiefs' defense stop the Lions' play-action? Here's last-minute intel for Week 6.

title: Who is going to the World Series? Expert predictions for ALCS, NLCS
content: The Dodgers, Brewers, Blue Jays and Mariners remain. Here's who we think will move on -- and how our playoff predictions have fared so far.

title: Tuchel's tough love on Bellingham could help England and the player at World Cup
content: England boss Thomas Tuchel wants unity, humility and hunger, even if it means sidelining his biggest name -- Jude Bellingham -- for now.

title: The unique way Pats coach Mike Vrabel selects weekly game captains: 'It's a dope thing'
content: Mike Reiss details what Patriots players describe as one of the highly anticipated parts of the week.

title: Offseason questions for eliminated teams: What's next for Cubs after NLDS defeat
content: Here's how the winter looks in Chicago -- and in the other towns whose teams lost their final postseason game.

title: The three stars who made the Aces three-time WNBA champs
content: Las Vegas won on the shoulders of A'ja Wilson, Chelsea Gray and Jackie Young. The trio has no plans to stop.

title: WNBA offseason guide: What's next for Mercury, champions Aces
content: As they head into a pivotal offseason, we break down the priorities and needs for each eliminated WNBA team.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United to move for Wharton
content: Crystal Palace midfielder Adam Wharton is a target for Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Walsh saves wasteful Chelsea in WSL win over Spurs
content: WSL champions Chelsea have drawn their last two games and had 27 shot attempts vs. Tottenham. But one moment of brilliance from Keira Walsh was enough.

title: Tiger Woods injuries: Timeline of some of the injuries from Tiger's career
content: From 2007 to now, Tiger Woods has had a number of serious injuries. Here's a look at some of the more impactful ones, starting with an ACL and ending with a ruptured Achilles tendon.

title: Cheat sheet: 2025-26 NBA player rankings, schedule grid, more
content: Here is all of our key fantasy basketball draft content -- rankings, sleepers, schedule grid and draft tips -- collected into downloadable/printable PDF cheat sheets.

title: Will not discuss alliance expectations in public: Selvaperunthagai
content: He says he will communicate State unit’s expectations to the All India Congress Committee and the DMK leadership

title: Attack on Telugu devotee in Tiruvannamalai sparks concern in Tirupati
content: Political analysts and social activists warn that rising Tamil‑Telugu tensions could strain inter‑State relations and local trade, urging that temples stay above politics

title: Commuters demand urgent repair of Hennur–Bagalur road linking Bengaluru airport
content: Commuters have argued that if repaired properly, the road could serve airport-bound traffic by cutting down travel time, fuel consumption, and congestion on the main highway leading to the airport

title: Government to file SLP in the Supreme Court over over 42% BC quota in local body polls
content: The government is confident that it has complied with all the conditions laid down by the Supreme Court in earlier judgments concerning reservations for BCs in local bodies

title: SIT probe into ‘misappropriation’ of Sabarimala Ayyappa temple artefacts expands to other States
content: A squad is in Chennai to interview the factory management contracted by Unnikrishnan Potti, the prime accused, to restore the gold-plated panels. Officials say the SIT may probe Potti’s antecedents in Bengaluru and Hyderabad.

title: India sends Minister as Sisi invites Modi to U.S.-Egypt Gaza peace signing ceremony
content: More than 20 world leaders to travel to Sharm el Sheikh on Monday; Egyptian Foreign Minister to travel to Delhi this week

title: NDA finalises seat-sharing pact for Bihar elections; BJP, JD(U) to contest 101 seats each
content: Smaller allies Chirag Paswan, Jitan Ram Manjhi, and Upendra Kushwaha allocated 29 and six seats each as alliance leaders project unity ahead of Assembly election

title: YSRCP to stage Statewide protests against spurious liquor trade on October 13
content: Party targets coalition government and TDP leaders, demands CBI probe, stricter Excise inspections, and support for families affected by toxic alcohol deaths

title: Chennai’s retail market sees 8% YoY growth in Q3 2025
content: Main streets dominated leasing activity with an 88% share, recording 0.14 million square feet of leasing - up 29% over the previous quarter, according to a report

title: Azhikodan Achamthuruthi team wins Kozhikode leg of Champion’s Boat League
content: While Palichom Achamthuruthi team bagged the second prize, AKG Podothuruthi A Team bagged the third prize in the championship that was witnessed by a massive crowd that assembled on both the banks of the river Chaliyar

title: Farmers plan to picket sugar factory in Gadag
content: ‘Farmers are stakeholders of the sugar factory and the factory management is duty bound to inform us about crushing’

title: CESL gears up to drive hydrogen bus revolution across India
content: Agency will focus on Hyderabad, Warangal, Mahabubnagar, Khammam to promote clean mobility in Telangana

title: Priyank Kharge asks CM to ban RSS activities on govt. facilities/sites, CM recommends immediate action
content: IT and BT, Rural Development and Panchayat Raj Minister Priyank Kharge has demanded that Chief Minister Siddaramaiah impose a ban on all Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh activities in government institutions and on public premises across Karnataka, stating that such actions are contrary to India’s unity and the spirit of the Constitution

title: Thalassemia patients flag shortage of leukocyte filter sets, iron chelation drugs
content: Even after blood transfusion, haemoglobin level among a section of thalassemia patients in Kerala is dipping. Also, the large amount of iron deposited in the body after blood transfusion harms internal organs since iron chelation drugs are in short supply

title: Bihar polls could upend decades of status quo despite caste arithmetic
content: While Nitish Kumar’s health and prospects of him continuing as Chief Minister for a full term if the NDA wins could bother the ruling alliance, the spectre of “jungle raj” under the previous RJD rule remains a generational trauma; challenging the status quo is the ‘X’ factor Prashant Kishor whose Jan Suraaj Party could cut votes of either of the alliances

title: Keep fighting for preservation of Kottooli wetlands: Sandeep Pandey
content: The protection of wetlands is more the responsibility of local bodies than of the State or Central governments, says the activist

title: Minister says Election Commission not taking action against Vote Chori
content: It has power to do so as an independent autonomous institution, according to Sharanabasappa Darshnapur

title: Call to establish Balaji railway division in Tirupati gets louder
content: The idea of a new division developed in the 1990s, however, remains a non-starter due to political disinterest, as the issue has been neglected during successive regimes

title: Minor, infant shifted to shelter home in Kozhikode
content: The move is part of the legal and protective measures initiated for the two after the alleged sexual abuse of the minor girl came to light when she recently delivered the baby, say police

title: Kerala Women Entrepreneurs’ Conclave 2025 to be held
content: Event aims to accelerate women’s participation in entrepreneurship and promote technology-driven business ventures in State

title: Field survey to identify feasible route for Poozhithode-Padinjarathara bypass completed
content: The survey to finalise the optimal alignment of the proposed bypass has been completed under the supervision of engineers from the Kozhikode-based Uralungal Labour Contract Cooperative Society

title: Kozhikode DCC seeks action against DySPs, officers for attack on Shafi
content: The attack on the MP happened after workers of the UDF and the LDF came face-to-face while taking out separate protest marches, following a conflict over the union election at CKG Memorial Government College and a ‘hartal’ called by the UDF

title: Cops identify 24 suspected abusers from visuals during training
content: Police personnel identified the perpetrators of child sexual abuse during the victim identification task force training conducted at the Kerala Police Academy in Thrissur between September 29 and October 9

title: Preliminary findings from Thirumalapuram excavations confirm Iron Age culture akin to Adichanallur
content: According to tentative estimates, the site could date back to the early to mid-third millennium BCE. The excavations have yielded a rich collection of ceramics found in graves and among grave goods

title: Integrity and service must define every uniform: DGP issues strong warning to fellow police personnel against corruption
content: Police stations must not become venues for settling civil disputes. Any officer found conducting such ‘panchayats’ in police premises would face strict action, warned the top cop.

title: Hyderabad Cyber Crimes police arrest 59 across India in September; ₹86.64 lakh refunded to victims
content: Of the recovered funds, ₹58,47,595 was linked to investment frauds, followed by ₹12,43,111 in trading frauds and ₹5,21,150 in OTP-related frauds. Other refunds included ₹3,34,065 in digital arrest scams, ₹2,58,635 in credit card frauds, ₹1,78,500 in job scams, ₹1,13,000 in impersonation cases, ₹50,000 in APK frauds, and ₹1,18,771 under general NCRP cases

title: Over 500 motorists booked for drunk driving in Cyberabad; KPHB, Medchal top list
content: During the previous week (October 6 to 11), courts disposed of 296 drunk driving cases, imposing fines on 264 offenders and sentencing 32 to jail; another 35 offenders were assigned social service as part of their punishment

title: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation’s draft policy for the elderly to ensure an active and healthy social life
content: Prepared in line with the proposed State policy, the draft includes wide-ranging recommendations for elderly welfare

title: BJP diluted RTI Act fearing their anti- people approach: Mahesh Goud
content: ‘2019 RTI amendments curtailed the independence of Information Commissions by bringing their tenure and service conditions under Central control’

title: Aiming at political resurgence, Catholic Congress to march across Kerala
content: Rights Protection March will be flagged off in Kasaragod on Monday. The march, which aims to draw attention to a range of public and community issues ‘ignored’ by political parties, will culminate with a sit-in at the Secretariat on October 24

title: TDB Vigilance report flags serious procedural lapses in gold-plating works at Sabarimala, puts TDB of 2019 under scrutiny
content: It is unlikely the gold-clad plates of the Dwarapalaka idols could have been sent to Chennai for electroplating without the knowledge of the then TDB members, the report says

title: Excise dept. keeps fingers crossed over applications for retail liquor shops
content: Officials confident that number of applications likely to cross the targets set for the licence period 2025-27

title: Congress leadership miffed with Chidambaram over remarks on Operation Blue Star
content: Party sources said that the Congress leadership was of the view that “senior leaders who have received everything from the party should be more careful in making public statements that embarrass the party”

title: Andhra Pradesh Information Commission headless since September, case backlog mounts
content: The APSIC has over 13,500 pending appeals and complaints, with an average waiting period of more than three years, says a report by Satark Nagrik Sangathan

title: Focus on eco-tourism is essential for sustainable development, says V-C
content: He was speaking after inaugurating a World Tourism Day programme got up by the Department of Tourism Studies and Karnataka Arts College

title: Tribals take out rally in Ranchi to protest Kurmis' demand for ST status
content: Kumudini Dhan, a tribal leader, said it is just a token protest by all 32 tribes of the State to showcase the tribal strength

title: Over 1 lakh single-teacher schools in India catering to over 33 lakh students: Data
content: The number of single-teacher schools has decreased from 1,18,190 in 2022–23 to 1,10,971 in 2023–24, recording a drop of around 6%

title: Tripura maintains 66% growth in startup recognition over five years: State government
content: Tripura has emerged as the rising innovation powerhouse in the northeast, a senior official who attended the Tamil Nadu Global Startup Summit said

title: North Bengaluru’s persistent civic issues highlighted during D.K. Shivakumar’s ‘Walk With Bengaluru’
content: Residents have brought up issues such as corruption, lack of infrastructure for pedestrians, poor road conditions, lack of bus services, and anti-social elements exploiting public space

title: Pydimamba temple in Vizianagaram to be developed with ₹1.80 crore
content: Government to acquire properties around the temple to create queue lines within temple premises and ensure a hassle-free darshan for the pilgrims

title: RTI systematically weakened as it exposed PM’s claims, says Congress
content: On the 20th anniversary of the transparency law, the Opposition party accuses the Modi government of “killing” the RTI to evade accountability

title: Tejasvi surya directs GSI to study tunnel road impact on Lalbagh geology
content: Tejasvi Surya has expressed deep concern that the proposed tunnel would pass directly beneath the three-billion-year-old Peninsular Gneiss, a National Geological Monument, warning that drilling through such an ancient rock formation would be ‘ecologically and geologically indefensible’

title: CRPF constable killed in Jharkhand IED blast cremated in native Assam village
content: The constable was injured, along with two others, in two IED explosions in Saranda Forest in Jharkhand’s West Singhbhum district on October 10

title: Police to deploy advanced surveillance technology ahead of Sathya Sai Baba’s centenary celebrations
content: Superintendent of Police performs ‘puja’ for the ₹1.39 crore digital surveillance project, which will be equipped with 216 CCTV cameras and day-and-night vision drones across Puttaparthi and its surroundings

title: Alert ASI helps in reuniting four-year-old boy with his mother at Indrakeeladri
content: Upon finding the weeping boy being taken away by a suspected kidnapper, ASI Satyanarayana intervenes and takes custody of the child, and informs temple officials, who restore the boy to his mother

title: Tamil Nadu government plans to borrow ₹39,000 crore in Q3 of FY2026
content: In the State’s Budget estimates for 2025-26, the Debt to GSDP Ratio was projected to be 26.07%, well within the target of 28.70% prescribed under the 15th Finance Commission

title: Bihar polls: HAM gets 6 seats in NDA formula; Manjhi warns of 'repercussions'
content: Bihar's NDA finalized seat-sharing for upcoming assembly elections, with BJP and JD(U) contesting 101 seats each. Hindustani Awam Morcha (Secular) chief Jitan Ram Manjhi expressed satisfaction with his party's six seats but hinted at potential repercussions for undervaluing HAM(S). The INDIA bloc, meanwhile, is still negotiating its formula.

title: Durand fault line: Pak's Taliban gamble has backfired
content: Afghanistan and Pakistan face renewed conflict along their volatile border. Deadly clashes erupted after Kabul accused Islamabad of bombing its territory. Pakistan claims Afghan forces attacked first. The Durand Line, a disputed border, is the flashpoint. Tensions have disrupted trade and raised regional alarm. Afghanistan denies harboring Pakistani militants, calling it an internal Pakistani issue.

title: US bar mass shooting: 4 dead and 20 injured in South Carolina; suspect at large
content: A mass shooting at Willie's Bar and Grill on St Helena Island, South Carolina, early Sunday morning resulted in at least four deaths and over 20 injuries. Authorities responded to the crowded establishment shortly before 1 am, finding multiple victims as people fled the scene. The investigation into persons of interest is ongoing, with the motive still unclear.

title: US tech company that faced China's 'anger' hours before Trump announced 100% tariffs
content: Escalating US-China trade tensions saw President Trump announce a 100% tariff on Chinese imports, effective November 1. In response, China launched an antitrust probe into US chip giant Qualcomm over its acquisition of Autotalks. This move, alongside other retaliatory measures targeting US interests, signals a significant escalation in the ongoing trade dispute.

title: Rare! 'You've always made us proud' - Sachin shares Sara pics
content: Cricket icon Sachin Tendulkar celebrated daughter Sara's 28th birthday with a heartfelt social media tribute.  Sara, who turns 28 on October 12, 2025, has carved her own path in biomedical sciences and nutrition, inspired by her family's values. She actively contributes to the Sachin Tendulkar Foundation, focusing on education and healthcare.

title: Trump’s China tariffs: Billions wiped out of crypto market; biggest single-day fall
content: Bitcoin experienced a significant 8.4% drop, leading a $19 billion market wipeout. This downturn was triggered by President Trump's escalation of the US-China trade war, including new tariffs and export controls. The crypto market saw massive liquidations, with over 1.6 million traders affected, raising concerns about broader market contagion.

title: OPT participation falls from 95% to 78% as Indian STEM students turn away from US
content: Indian STEM graduates are increasingly foregoing US careers after studies, with OPT participation dropping significantly. This shift stems from US immigration uncertainties and visa challenges, while countries like Canada and the UK offer clearer, faster work and residency pathways. The trend impacts US universities and employers, reflecting changing priorities for Indian talent seeking stable global careers.

title: 'Have other options if ...': Afghanistan warns Pak amid deadly clash; Torkham border shut
content: Afghanistan's Foreign Minister warned of "other options" if peace talks with Pakistan fail, following intense border clashes. Kabul claims retaliatory operations achieved objectives with no civilian harm, accusing "elements in Pakistan" of seeking instability. Pakistan, however, labelled the strikes "unprovoked" and a "blatant violation of international laws."

title: Controversy in Pakistan! Raja mocks Babar on-air - 'Yeh drama karega'
content: Former cricketer Ramiz Raja's on-air comment about Pakistan captain Babar Azam during a Test match has sparked a stir online. While Babar reviewed a caught-behind decision, Raja was heard suggesting he would "create drama" if given out. The incident occurred during the first Test against South Africa, with Babar eventually scoring 23.

title: Microsoft engineer quits after 13 years; sends resignation email to employees
content: A senior Microsoft engineer has resigned protesting the company's cloud contracts with the Israeli military. Scott Sutfin-Glowski cited enabling potential atrocities as his reason for leaving. This follows months of internal dissent and employee firings over Gaza-related demonstrations. Microsoft previously stopped some services to an Israeli intelligence unit after a report. However, many contracts remain active, and employee protests continue. Activists demand a complete cut of ties with Israel.

title: Brad Marchand leads Panthers amid Barkov and Tkachuk injuries
content: Brad Marchand has quickly become the Florida Panthers' emotional and strategic leader, guiding the team through a challenging start to the 2025-26 season.  Despite the absence of captain Aleksander Barkov and star forward Matthew Tkachuk, Marchand's veteran presence and adaptability have been instrumental in Florida's perfect 3-0-0 record, keeping their championship hopes alive.

title: 'Idea of free-thinking under attack in India': Rahul targets Centre from abroad again
content: Rahul Gandhi, speaking abroad, voiced concerns that free and scientific thinking faces a significant challenge in India. He emphasized the need for an inclusive education system fostering curiosity and critical thought, calling it the bedrock of freedom. These remarks follow his earlier critique of India's democracy, drawing sharp criticism from the BJP.

title: Explained: How this China spy scandal could derail US-UK ties
content: Why the collapse of a British espionage trial could damage one of the world’s closest intelligence alliances

title: Ayesha Curry’s marriage confession sparks backlash as NFL star Cam Newton steps in
content: NBA star Stephen Curry's wife, Ayesha, faced fan backlash for her candid remarks about not initially wanting marriage or children. Despite criticism, she received support from figures like Cam Newton, who praised her honesty.  Others, including Gilbert Arenas and Stephen himself, have rallied behind her, highlighting the misunderstanding of her sentiments.

title: Jaz Elle’s one-word reply melts hearts on Agassi’s iconic style
content: Tennis icon Andre Agassi, fresh off leading Team World to victory at the 2025 Laver Cup, delighted fans with a throwback post of his iconic 80s and 90s fashion. His daughter, Jaz Elle Agassi, praised his "Majestic" style. Agassi also shared his competitive spirit as captain, calling the win a "special week."

title: 'She’s really scared': Taylor Swift’s behavior leaves Blake Lively worried about future
content: Blake Lively is reportedly anxious about her career following a supposed rift with close friend Taylor Swift. Sources suggest Lively fears Swift's significant influence in Hollywood could impact her professional future. Despite attempts to reconcile, Lively is said to be struggling with the silence from Swift, who has yet to address the alleged fallout publicly.

title: Bengal 'gang rape' horror: BJP leaders stopped from meeting victim; spar with cops
content: BJP leaders were prevented from meeting a med student allegedly gangraped in Durgapur, sparking accusations of a flawed probe. CM Mamata Banerjee's advice for girls to stay indoors at night drew sharp criticism, with one MLA comparing her administration to the Taliban. The accused have been remanded to police custody.

title: How one Trump call convinced Hamas to take Gaza peace deal seriously
content: A September Israeli bombing in Doha nearly derailed Gaza peace talks, prompting Qatar to threaten withdrawal. However, a direct intervention by Donald Trump, including a phone call between Netanyahu and Qatar's PM, salvaged the negotiations. This moment convinced Hamas of Trump's ability to influence Israel, paving the way for a significant ceasefire.

title: Birthday bliss! Hardik Pandya enjoys special day with girlfriend Mahieka Sharma - WATCH
content: Indian all-rounder Hardik Pandya celebrated his 32nd birthday with girlfriend Mahieka Sharma on a romantic beach getaway. Glimpses shared on Instagram revealed a candlelit dinner, thoughtful surprises, and a serene beach stroll, marking the first public confirmation of their relationship. Pandya also shared family moments with his son Agastya, mother, and grandmother.

title: Mets eye $10.15M Tigers star amid Pete Alonso free agency concerns
content: The New York Mets, after a disappointing season, are reportedly eyeing Detroit Tigers ace Tarik Skubal as a potential game-changer.  With Pete Alonso's free agency looming, acquiring the Cy Young winner could significantly bolster their pitching rotation, offering stability and a strong foundation for future contention, even with a substantial financial commitment.

title: Kuldeep Yadav’s artistry flattens West Indies, but John Campbell–Shai Hope rescue stand delays India’s charge
content: John Campbell's unbeaten 87 and Shai Hope's 66 led West Indies' strong resistance on day three, reaching 173 for two after being forced to follow on. Despite trailing by 97 runs, their unbroken 138-run partnership offered a glimmer of hope against India's bowlers, who were earlier stifled by Kuldeep Yadav's five-wicket haul.

title: No Nobel Prize in Mathematics: Why Alfred Nobel left the subject out of the honours
content: Alfred Nobel's will established prestigious awards for science, literature, and peace, but notably excluded mathematics. While popular myths abound, historical context suggests Nobel favored practical applications. Mathematicians are recognized through economics and specialized awards like the Fields Medal and Abel Prize, often dubbed the "Nobel of Mathematics."

title: When Trump's tariff push met Beijing's counterpunch; US-China trade war explained
content: US-China trade tensions have reignited with Beijing imposing rare earth export curbs, sparking retaliation from Washington. China accuses the US of unfair practices, while the US criticizes China's actions as hostile. Both nations are now using export controls as leverage ahead of upcoming talks, potentially reshaping global supply chains and testing diplomatic limits.

title: Bihar polls: All eyes on seat-sharing deal; what's delaying INDIA bloc’s announcement?
content: Bihar's political landscape is buzzing with seat-sharing talks for the upcoming elections. While the NDA appears close to finalizing its allocations, the INDIA bloc faces continued uncertainty, particularly between the RJD and Congress.  Discussions are ongoing, with leaders heading to Delhi to resolve the deadlock and finalize candidate lists soon.

title: Niti Aayog forecasts 4mn AI jobs by 2030: What roles will emerge; who benefits?
content: NITI Aayog’s Roadmap for Job Creation in the AI Economy outlines how Artificial Intelligence could create up to 4 million new jobs in India by 2030. While warning of displacement in routine tech roles, the report identifies emerging careers in AI engineering, ethics, training, and human-AI collaboration. It advocates for a National AI Talent Mission to drive education and reskilling. The roadmap positions India as a global hub for AI talent and innovation by 2035.

title: Former Canadian PM Justin Trudeau and singer Katy Perry spotted on a yacht-- Pictures go viral
content: New photos of Justin Trudeau and Katy Perry vacationing together off the California coast have reignited romance rumors. The pair were seen sharing intimate moments on a yacht, sparking widespread speculation. This follows earlier sightings and reports of a budding connection, despite previous claims of things cooling off due to busy schedules. Both stars are reportedly single after recent breakups.

title: ‘UP CM is infiltrator’: Akhilesh calls out Adityanath’s Uttarakhand link
content: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav has attacked Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath. Yadav referred to Adityanath as an 'infiltrator' and suggested he should be sent back to Uttarakhand. The remarks were made on the death anniversary of Ram Manohar Lohia. Yadav also accused the BJP of using fake data.

title: New Record! Smriti Mandhana creates history with stellar knock against Australia, becomes quickest to...
content: Smriti Mandhana has shattered records, becoming the youngest and fastest to 5000 ODI runs in women's cricket. Her brilliant 80 against Australia in Visakhapatnam showcased her exceptional talent and consistency. This remarkable feat underscores her status as a global cricketing icon and highlights the rising prominence of Indian women's cricket.

title: 'Was working to rebuild terror infra': IDF eliminates Hezbollah operative - Video
content: Israeli forces conducted drone strikes in southern Lebanon, eliminating a Hezbollah operative involved in rebuilding the group's military infrastructure. An engineering vehicle was also targeted. These actions occur amidst escalating border tensions. Meanwhile, in Gaza, hundreds of thousands have returned to northern areas post-Israeli troop withdrawal, with a ceasefire and hostage release deal nearing finalization at an upcoming Egypt summit.

title: Bihar shocker: Man burns wife alive; wanted to marry lover
content: A 25-year-old woman was allegedly burnt alive by her husband in Nalanda district, with her family claiming he wanted to remarry his girlfriend. The accused husband and his parents fled the village after the incident. Police are conducting raids to apprehend the suspects.

title: Kumar Sanu moves to court to seek protection of his personality rights
content: Playback singer Kumar Sanu has filed a petition in the Delhi High Court seeking protection for his personality and publicity rights. The plea aims to prevent unauthorized commercial use of his voice, name, image, and singing style, especially from AI-generated content and online imitations that could mislead the public and damage his reputation.

title: 'No deliberate exclusion': Muttaqi holds another presser; women journos present
content: Taliban's Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi addressed a press conference in Delhi with both male and female journalists present, following criticism for excluding women from a previous event. Muttaqi stated the earlier exclusion was due to short notice, not deliberate intent. This visit marks the first by a senior Taliban minister to India since the group's takeover.

title: Japan declares nationwide flu outbreak; over 4,000 hospitalised amid concerns
content: Japan is facing a nationwide flu outbreak. Cases have surged significantly, leading to hospitalizations and school closures. This epidemic has arrived nearly five weeks earlier than expected. Health officials are urging immediate vaccination for vulnerable groups. Experts suggest this early start may become more common due to global environmental changes. Precautions like mask-wearing and handwashing are advised. Read more below!

title: IND vs WI | Pacer hits Jaiswal with ball; fined for 'inappropriate' conduct
content: West Indies pacer Jayden Seales has been fined 25% of his match fee and received one demerit point for a Level 1 ICC Code of Conduct breach. The incident involved Seales throwing the ball at batter Yashasvi Jaiswal's pads after fielding it. The match referee ruled the throw inappropriate and dangerous, despite Seales' claim of attempting a run-out.

title: Mutiny in Madagascar: Army unit claims control of military; president says coup under way
content: A mutinied army unit in Madagascar, CAPSAT, announced it has taken control of the military, challenging President Rajoelina's authority. This development follows weeks of anti-government protests fueled by shortages, with CAPSAT officers refusing to fire on demonstrators. The group's statement asserts all military orders will now come from their headquarters, escalating the political crisis.

title: IND vs WI | Gill takes unbelievable diving catch - Watch
content: Shubman Gill's spectacular diving catch ignited India's charge on Day 3 of the second Test against West Indies. Following a dominant bowling performance led by Kuldeep Yadav's five-wicket haul, India enforced the follow-on. The West Indies, struggling at 35 for 2 at tea, face a daunting task to avoid defeat.

title: MBBS student rape case: Survivor’s father alleges threat in Bengal
content: Three individuals have been arrested in connection with the gang rape of a medical student in West Bengal's Paschim Bardhaman district. The survivor, who has recorded her statement, is on bedrest and her father has requested to move her to Odisha for safety. The incident has sparked political tension and calls for swift justice.

title: Silent layoffs surge in Indian IT; why it’s happening; subtle signs to watch now
content: Indian IT firms are undergoing major workforce shifts in 2025. Over 50,000 tech jobs face potential cuts as companies integrate AI and automation. Major players like TCS, Infosys, and Wipro are restructuring teams. This trend reflects evolving skill demands and global economic pressures. Employees are experiencing attrition, contract non-renewals, and silent layoffs.

title: Watch: Rs 30-lakh gold-plated urn stolen from Delhi temple
content: A gold-plated urn, valued at Rs 30 lakh, was stolen from the spire of a Jain temple in Jyoti Nagar, North East Delhi. CCTV footage revealed an unidentified man scaling the temple roof using electric wires to access the spire and remove the urn. A case has been registered following the incident.

title: Shawshank-style heist: How a murder accused tricked Azamgarh jail officials; siphoned Rs 30L
content: A murder accused in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh jail masterminded a Rs 30 lakh fraud, siphoning funds from the jail's account after obtaining a chequebook on bail.  He, along with a fellow inmate, a senior assistant, and a watchman, forged signatures to transfer the money. The scheme unraveled after the jail superintendent noticed suspicious withdrawals.

title: Fire Breaks Out At Historic Italian Monastery, Nuns Escape Unhurt
content: A vast blaze has torn through the historic Bernaga Monastery in northern Italy, the Italian fire service said Sunday, forcing the evacuation of 22 cloistered nuns.

title: UP Man Rapes Woman After Fake Promise Of Meeting With Seer, Arrested
content: Police have arrested a man accused of raping a woman by luring her with the promise of a private meeting with Premanand Maharaj in Vrindavan, officials said on Sunday.

title: Madagascar Army Unit Takes Control Of Military, Joins GenZ Protests
content: A mutinied army unit declared Sunday that it was taking control of all Madagascar military forces as President Andry Rajoelina said an "attempt to seize power illegally" was under way.

title: What Taliban Minister Told NDTV When Asked About Pak-Afghan Clashes
content: Both Pakistan and Afghanistan want good relations and regional peace, Taliban's Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi said at his second press conference in New Delhi, this time with women journalists in attendance.

title: Zelensky Asks For Air Defences, Missiles During Call With Macron
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky asked for more air defences and missiles in a call with French counterpart Emmanuel Macron on Sunday.

title: "Attacks On Independent Thinking": Rahul Gandhi's Remarks In Chile Irk BJP
content: A comment from Congress's Rahul Gandhi made abroad, has infuriated the BJP again. The party has hit out, accusing him of besmirching India on foreign soil again.

title: Trump Heads To Israel, Egypt As Gaza Ceasefire Takes Effect
content: President Donald Trump is setting off for Israel and Egypt on Sunday to celebrate the US-brokered ceasefire and hostage deal between Israel and Hamas and urge Middle East allies to seize the opportunity to build a durable peace in the region.

title: Russia's Big Warning Amid Buzz US May Give Tomahawk Missiles To Ukraine
content: The Kremlin said on Sunday that Russia was deeply concerned about the possibility of the US supplying Tomahawk missiles to Ukraine, warning that the war had reached a dramatic moment with escalation from all sides.

title: 85-Year-Old Woman Breaks Down As Tree She Cared For 20 Years Is Cut
content: An 85-year-old woman in Chhattisgarh's Khairagarh district broke down in tears after a peepal tree she had nurtured for over two decades was illegally cut down in her village

title: Trump Declares Victory On Inflation, But Americans Aren't Buying It
content: Inflation has risen in three of the last four months and is slightly higher than it was a year ago, when it helped sink then-Vice President Kamala Harris' presidential campaign. Yet you wouldn't know it from listening to President Donald Trump.

title: Arab States Quietly Teamed Up With Israel While Condemning Gaza War: Report
content: While Israel faced international criticism for its war in Gaza, key Arab nations were secretly strengthening military ties with the Israeli armed forces, according to leaked US files.

title: Chemistry Scholar With MPhil Turned Bank Robber. How Law Caught Up With Him
content: Last week, Delhi Police Head Constable Ajay got information that Deep Shubham, wanted in multiple bank robbery cases, was spotted in Haryana's Sohna area. The cops then used technical surveillance to track Deep down and arrested him

title: China Coast Guard Rams, Damages Philippine Vessel Off South China Sea Island
content: A Chinese coast guard ship used a powerful water cannon then rammed and slightly damaged an anchored Philippine government vessel off an island inhabited by Filipinos in the disputed South China Sea.

title: Shots Fired, Borders Shut: Heavy Clashes Between Pak, Afghanistan Forces
content: Key border crossings between Pakistan and Afghanistan were closed on Sunday after fierce clashes erupted overnight following Taliban accusations that Islamabad had carried out air strikes this week, officials said.

title: Hamas Won't Take Part in Post-War Gaza Governance: Source Close To Group
content: A Hamas source close to the group's negotiating committee told AFP that it will not participate in post-war Gaza governance, as world leaders prepare to converge on Egypt for a Gaza peace summit.

title: 'Trump: Tehelka Macha Doonga; Nobel Body: Machado': Congress MP's "Poor Joke"
content: In a self-proclaimed "poor joke", senior Congress leader and eminent lawyer Abhishek Singhvi has come up with a witty wordplay on Venezuelan leader Maria Corina Machado winning the Nobel Peace Prize

title: Afghan Minister Clarifies After Outrage Over No Women Journalists At Presser
content: Afghanistan Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi on Sunday justified the absence of female journalists from his earlier press conference as a "technical issue", days after the incident sparked a major controversy for "insulting women".

title: "Profits For A Quarter, Purpose For Life": Vivek Oberoi's Business Mantra
content: Bollywood actor Vivek Oberoi has revealed he values assets more than money and prioritises long-term commitments over short-term gains.

title: "How Was She Out At 12.30 am?" Mamata Banerjee's Shocker After Gang Rape
content: In shocking remarks in the aftermath of an MBBS student's gangrape in West Bengal's Durgapur, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has tried to shift the responsibility of students' security to private colleges

title: Border Security Force's Air Wing Gets Its First Woman Flight Engineer
content: The Border Security Force (BSF) air wing has got its first woman flight engineer in its over 50 years history following completion of a first in-house training capsule.

title: Way-Too-Early WNBA Power Rankings: Early look at 2026
content: the Las Vegas Aces are the 2025 champions after a WNBA Finals sweep over the Phoenix Mercury . this offseason will be the busiest in league history . a new collective bargaining agreement is needed, plus expansion drafts for two new franchises .

title: Sources eye bevy of NFL trades before deadline
content: the three trades completed this week are expected to be a sign of things to come ahead of the league's Nov. 4 trade deadline . in a copycat league where teams constantly are striving to improve, general managers already have begun exploring additional trades . there could be at least another dozen to come, league sources say .

title: Follow live: Nix-to-Adkins TD pass has Broncos ahead in London
content: Sunday's NFL Week 6 action kicked off early in London, with the  New York Jets  facing the  Denver Broncos  at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium in the league's third straight international game. The Jets (0-5) come in as the NFL's lone winless team as the Broncos (3-2) come in riding a two-game win streak. Follow along here for real-time highlights, analysis and key moments from Sunday's games:

title: Best of Week 7: Indiana is a genuine power on the national stage
content: college football has been defined by what's new in college football . it has been nearly three decades since we've had a first-time national champion . the biggest brands have continued to dominate the sport . there's the transfer portal, NIL money, revenue sharing, revamped rosters, realignment .

title: Brewers or Dodgers? Blue Jays or Mariners? What final four must do to reach Fall Classic
content: the 2025 league championship series is set for a trip to the world series on the line . the next day, the defending champion Los Angeles Dodgers and top-seeded Milwaukee Brewers will begin their series on a national league side of the bracket .

title: WWE Crown Jewel takeaways: Cena, Styles pass the torch to Rollins, Rhodes
content: the match between two retiring legends at the end of this year and Styles in 2026 featured an impressive amount of tributes to past opponents and WWE legends . only The Undertaker has more with 107, a record we will have to wait a while to see broken .

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 at midseason: Buckeyes the team to beat
content: Ohio State has emerged as the clear favorite in "SportsCenter" at the midpoint of the season, Penn State has three losses . Texas is trying to claw its way back into the playoff conversation, and undefeated Indiana is a top five team . the battle for no. 1 is ongoing .

title: Should Cowboys extend red-hot Javonte Williams before he becomes a free agent?
content: Javonte Williams is a weekly reliable RB for fantasy managers . he is third in the NFL with 447 rushing yards and tied for second with five rushing touchdowns on 79 carries . his one-year contract could pay him up to $3.5 million .

title: How much longer can the Phillies keep contending?
content: the final play of the national league division series against the los Angeles Dodgers will live in your nightmares for a long time . the Phillies were eliminated in Game 4 of the NLDS . there were two other short throws from Game 2 that might have impacted the outcome of the series .
